message.content:
cs.DC, cs.DB, cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.DS 

This paper describes the design and implementation of a high performance cloud for archiving, analyzing, and mining large distributed data sets. The paper focuses on the design of the Sector storage cloud and the Sphere compute cloud, which are designed for analyzing large data sets using computer clusters connected with wide area high performance networks. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). The paper also discusses the programming paradigm supported by the Sphere compute cloud, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.DB (Databases) or cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). The paper also mentions experimental studies comparing Sector/Sphere to Hadoop, which could place it in cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) or cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture).
